extends net.openhft.chronicle.wire.AbstractBytesMarshallable

      • signed

        public final boolean signed()
        Description copied from interface: SignedMessage
        Returns if this message is signed. Once a message is signed it can't be modified, only read.

        It cannot be sent until it is signed.

        Specified by:
        signed in interface SignedMessage
        Returns:
        true if signed, false if not signed

      • writeMarshallable

        public final void writeMarshallable(net.openhft.chronicle.bytes.BytesOut bytes)
        Writes the content of this signed message to the provided bytes. The source of the content is taken from an internal Bytes store.
        Specified by:
        writeMarshallable in interface net.openhft.chronicle.bytes.BytesMarshallable

      • writeMarshallableInternal

        protected void writeMarshallableInternal(net.openhft.chronicle.bytes.BytesOut bytes)
        Writes the content of the fields of this messages (non-transitive and non-transitive) fields to the proved bytes.

        This method is called upon signing this message.

        Parameters:
        bytes - to write to

      • address

        public final long address()
        Description copied from interface: SignedMessage
        Returns a unique address for the sender. This should be the last 8 bytes of the public key.
        Specified by:
        address in interface SignedMessage
        Returns:
        a unique id for this server.

        this message.
        Throws:

      • timestampUS

        public final long timestampUS()
        Description copied from interface: SignedMessage
        Returns a microsecond precision, unique monotonically increasing timestamp

        NOTE: If the writing system doesn't have a micro-second accurate clock, the most accurate clock should be used and increment the timestamp in the cause of any collision

        Specified by:
        timestampUS in interface SignedMessage
        Returns:
        a unique microsecond timestamp for an address. Must be monotonically increasing.

        Parameters:
        timestampUS - to use
        Returns:
        this message.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the message was already signed

      • sign

        public final T sign(@NotNull
                    net.openhft.chronicle.bytes.BytesStore secretKey)
        Description copied from interface: SignedMessage
        Signs and returns this message. As an additional side effect, also sets the public key (if any) and address in this message.
        Specified by:
        sign in interface SignedMessage
        Parameters:
        secretKey - to sign this message with.
        Returns:

      • sign

        public T sign(@NotNull
              net.openhft.chronicle.bytes.BytesStore secretKey,
              @NotNull
              net.openhft.chronicle.core.time.TimeProvider timeProvider)
        Signs this message with the provided secretKey and provided timeProvider.

        After a message has been signed, its properties cannot be changed any more.

        Parameters:
        secretKey - to use for signing
        timeProvider - to use for generating a timestamp
        Returns:
        this message
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this message has already been signed or if the protocol has not been set or if the message type has not been set.

      • byteBuffer

        public final ByteBuffer byteBuffer()
        Returns the ByteBuffer view of this message's binary content. As a side effect, resets the internal ByteBuffer view.

        The message must be signed before this method is invoked

        There is only a single view of this message's binary content.

        Returns:
        a ByteBuffer view of the signed content of this message
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the message has not been signed.
